thread.title: Police and NCC head Major-Club Cricket points table
thread.title_full: Police and NCC head Major-Club Cricket points table

title: Police and NCC head Major-Club Cricket points table
text:
Ravindu Fernando, the Bloomfield off-spinner, took a match bag of 11 wickets.
Police SC and NCC are at the top of their respective groups after the fourth week of the Major-Club 3-day cricket tournament conducted by Sri Lanka Cricket.
Police SC, led by Ashen Bandara, has won 2 out of 4 matches, earning 47.335 points in Group ‘A.’ In second place is Panadura SC with 47.195 points. Bloomfield, led by Nipuna Karunanayake, moved to third place in Group ‘A’ with 38.34 points after recording an innings and 4-run win over Chilaw Marians, having won 2 out of 3 matches. Ace Capital CC is in fourth place with 37.175 points.
Colts CC finished their last game in a draw against Panadura SC and is in fifth place with 36.675 points.
Meanwhile, in Group ‘B,’ NCC is at the top with 47.65 points after 3 matches and 2 wins. Last week, Moors SC recorded an innings and 73-run victory over Nugegoda SC, moving them to second place in Group ‘B’ with 47.325 points. Kurunegala YCC (32.705 points) and CCC (30.81 points) hold the third and fourth spots, respectively.
Dilum Sudeera, the leg-spinner for Police SC, is the leading wicket-taker with 34 wickets, including a five-wicket haul against Negombo CC. This is his fourth five-wicket haul of the tournament, with best figures of 8 for 50 against Baduraliya SC. Bloomfield off-spinner, Ravindu Fernando, took a match bag of 11 wickets (5/32 and 6/50) and has 22 wickets, making him the second-highest wicket-taker. Ragama CC leg-spinner Shashika Dulshan follows closely with 20 wickets.
Kandy Customs CC right-handed batsman Sahan Kosala continued his excellent form by scoring another half-century last week, leading the batters with 488 runs in 7 innings at an average of 81.33. His teammate Roscoe Thattil is in second place with 354 runs at an average of 48.32, while Colts CC opener Ravindu Rashantha is third, having scored 331 runs in 5 innings at an average of 66.20.
Six matches are scheduled for today (24), with Moors SC vs. CCC at Colts grounds being the key matchup.
